title: Boolean attribute (HTML)
summary: A boolean attribute in HTML is an attribute that represents true or false values. If an HTML tag contains a boolean attribute - no matter the value of that attribute - the attribute is set to true on that element. If an HTML tag does not contain the attribute, the attribute is set to false.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
